scl10.uk.ac.aber.users.neuralnetwork

Class ConvolutionLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • scl10.uk.ac.aber.users.neuralnetwork.FullyConnectedLayer
      • scl10.uk.ac.aber.users.neuralnetwork.ConvolutionLayer

  • class ConvolutionLayer
extends FullyConnectedLayer
    This class is incomplete

    This class represents the concepts of convolution layer within a neural network.

    Author:
    Scott Lockett

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int CNN_HIDDEN_LAYER_SIZE
      This hidden layer will be the same size as the input layer.
      private static int CNN_INPUT_SIZE
      The CNN layer's input is trained using a set patch size that is (7 x 7 =) 49 pixels.
      private static int CNN_OUTPUT_SIZE
      The CNN layer's output is trained using the ground truth x and y shift between the central pixel.
      private static org.slf4j.Logger LOGGER
      Logger for logging user information

    • Field Detail

      • CNN_HIDDEN_LAYER_SIZE

        private static final int CNN_HIDDEN_LAYER_SIZE
        This hidden layer will be the same size as the input layer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CNN_INPUT_SIZE

        private static final int CNN_INPUT_SIZE
        The CNN layer's input is trained using a set patch size that is (7 x 7 =) 49 pixels. Two flattened patches are used to train and test the CNN so it will always be a set size.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CNN_OUTPUT_SIZE

        private static final int CNN_OUTPUT_SIZE
        The CNN layer's output is trained using the ground truth x and y shift between the central pixel. This will also always be a set size.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOGGER

        private static final org.slf4j.Logger LOGGER
        Logger for logging user information

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConvolutionLayer

        public ConvolutionLayer()
        Creates a new convolution layer.

    • Method Detail

      • calculate

        public double[][][] calculate(@NonNull
                              java.awt.image.BufferedImage source,
                              @NonNull
                              java.awt.image.BufferedImage target)
        Tests the convolutional neural network with the two images. The images are broken into patches in order to create a predicted warp.
        Parameters:
        source - The source image. cannot be null.
        target - The target image. cannot be null.
        Returns:
        a 3D array of doubles that represent the x warp and y warp output from the convolution layer.

      • trainNetwork

        public void trainNetwork(@NonNull
                         java.awt.image.BufferedImage source,
                         @NonNull
                         java.awt.image.BufferedImage target,
                         @NonNull
                         double[][] xWarp,
                         @NonNull
                         double[][] yWarp)
        Trains the convolution layer with two images broken down into patches. The patch is used as input into the convolution layer. The central pixel from each patch has a x and y shift used as ground truth. This ground truth is used as the output from the neural network.
        Parameters:
        source - The source image. cannot be null.
        target - The target image. cannot be null.
        xWarp - The ground truth x warp between the target and source image. cannot be null.
        yWarp - The ground truth y warp between the target and source image. cannot be null.
